context: °C). • Dioxin/furan production occurs at the combustion catalyst. • Catalytic and thermal oxidizers may be destroying dioxins fed from the ambient air. • Small variations in temperature cause large changes in the congener distribution of the dioxin and furan isomers. • Molar yields from the parent compounds fed to the oxidizers to the toxic equivalents of 2,3,7,8-TCDD are very small (10−9–10−13). • The oxidation of chlorinated VOCs with non-chlorinated VOCs reduces emissions of dioxins. Concern from both the public and the US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has been directed at the formation and control of PCDDs/Fs from combustion systems.
